Literally my favorite game, I found this game at my cousin's house, and I love the atmosphere. The game has an amazing idea along with an amazing design to go along with it. This game doesn't have the best community to put it lightly, but if you put enough hours in, the game becomes much easier because you understand what to do. Just don't click flashlights, or spam crouch at killers and you'll be set, after you figure out which perks, killers, and survivors you want to play. game rating- 9/10

The meta will never change until the top perks/killer/addons etc are toned down. adding new op shit/ buffing existing stuff to the extreme to be able to compete will not solve the problem, but rather make it worse.

For an Asymmetrical game, it is pretty balanced. Great game, great concept. Matchmaking could be a little better, and the survivor side being team-reliant always creates frustrations. But other than those two little gripes, I have had a ton of fun with this game!

Эта игра не вызывает ничего кроме боли и страданий от токсичного коммьюнити, которое будет издеваться над тобой любыми доступными средствами, причем неважно маньяк ты или выживший издеваться будут одинаково. Если выживший будут тунелить и кемпить. Если маньяк будут бегать от тебя по несколько минут и хрен поймешь высокорангового выжившего, тем более когда ты низкоранговый маньяк, спасибо системе подбора, которая к таким подбрасывает. Я уже не говорю об этой блядской традиции ждать у выхода. Нахера? Все вы выиграли уйдите, нахера ждать и тянуть время?

The content updates for Dead by Daylight consist almost exclusively of new characters, or, if we are lucky, a new realm. The survivor and killer gameplay has fundamentally not changed (escaping or killing everyone). Combined, these two result in stale and tedious matches on either side; the updates that do provide relief, are non-satiating and don't last long. In addition, they only come every 3 months or so, meaning major changes occur only 4 times a year.

After awhile you begin to notice that 95% of success is dependent on how fast you can be at doing gens or finishing chases, and most perks/powers that are added to the game are just novel ways to shorten those times. If the perk or power doesn't help enough there is no reason to run it, even if that means playing one build or killer on loop for months for consistent wins. The quantity of effort, time, or money you need to invest in the game just to have every perk, and character is unrealistic, however it is the only way you can have fun after a certain amount of time, since winning isn't enough. The game is very enjoyable, but it does not endure past about 200 hours of playtime unless you play customs with friends, or you ignore that you could be playing something more enjoyable. 

One main thing that I theorize is the root of Dead by Daylight's problems is that it was created as a horror game, so the imperfections and non-balanced nature of the game was ignored until it became less scary. With this, timing became more important, and it was clear that Dead by Daylight needed to be balanced. Since then, the devs have been playing catch up to make either role feel happy, when they should be addressing the fundamentally bad direction the game is moving in; due to it being a horror game. 

TLDR ish- The game is not a horror game unless you find wasting your time to be horrifying. Updates are now focused on making the game "balanced" rather than fun. Also, personally, I liked the old map colors because they were much more scary. The game is fun for awhile but become boring if you play for a long time. (Just play nurse if you want to win)
